title: Area vectors - definition for cylinder ends

content.question: A closed cylinder has a circular face on each end with an area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>. How are the area vectors of the circular faces defined?

choices.label: Each face has a single area vector perpendicular to the plane of the surface and directed outwards from the cylinder.
Each face has a single area vector perpendicular to the plane of the surface and directed inwards towards the cylinder.
Each face has a single area vector parallel to the surface of the cylinder.
Each face has two area vectors parallel to the surface but perpendicular to each other.

content.answer: Each face has a single area vector perpendicular to the plane of the surface and directed outwards from the cylinder.
